subject: Learning
title: Think-Alouds: Making Thinking Visible
description: A fast breakdown of Think-Alouds: Making Thinking Visible for builders.

hook.text: A teacher solves a math problem out loud: 'I notice a pattern, I wonder if it holds, let me try.'

buildup.text: Think-alouds make invisible cognitive processes visible, showing students how experts think.

discovery.text: Students who hear think-alouds learn not just the answer but the reasoning process behind it.

twist.text: When students do their own think-alouds, they catch errors and gaps they'd otherwise miss.

climax.text: Think-alouds are one of the simplest and most effective metacognitive teaching tools available.

punchline.text: Show the messy thinking, not just the clean answer.

quiz.question: Why are think-alouds effective for teaching metacognition?
options: They make invisible cognitive processes visible for students
They replace the need for practice entirely
Only math teachers can use them effectively
